name: Tech Startup Launchpad

constraints.type_string: Fulfill all of the following requirements

long_desc: This course provides handson learning about what it is like to start and launch a technology startup company. You will work within a team of students to turn your idea into a real company. You will learn and apply modern concepts practiced today in top innovation hubs around the globe lean startup, minimum viable product, customer development, productmarket fit, agile product development, business model generation, competitive landscape, etc. The goal of this course is not to write a business plan, prepare a venture capital presentation, or write tedious progress reports. You will learn what it takes to quickly develop your idea into a prototype, turn it into a minimum viable product and launch it, while you concurrently 1 talk to and cultivate potential customers, and 2 develop and iterate on your business model.  This course is designed for BA, CS, IS seniors nonIS seniors should obtain instructor permission to enroll in this class.

custom_fields.goals: 1. Identify problems worth solving and propose innovative IT based solutions in a real world setting.2. Develop, analyze and validate business models with the goal of bringing technological solutions to the market. 3. Design, develop and prototype the solutions.4. Formulate business plans and presentations that articulate both business and technical perspectives. 5. Demonstrate ability to work collaboratively in team with entrepreneur mindset.
custom_fields.key_topics: This course introduces students to tech startup, lean startup, business model canvas, value proposition canvas, market analysis, product market fit analysis, prototype development, pitching for investors, preparing business proposal.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: 67-272 is a prerequisite for this course unless otherwise approved by the instructor. Junior and Senior students are suitable for enrolment.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessments in the course typically include team based major project on tech startup, case analysis, presentation, field studies.
custom_fields.relevance: This course introduces students to possible carrer path in tech startups.
custom_fields.learning_resources: This course is to combine real world practice with up¿to¿date textbook, case studies, and basic hand-on business development skills. The textbook serves to supplement the class materials providing deeper explanations that professor will highlight the importance points.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: This is a 9 units course. On average, a student is expected to spend 9 hours a week on this course, consisiting of 3 hours in class and 6 hours of self study.
